company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Data
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

 As a Data Center Engineer in the Data Center Engineering & Operations group, the ideal candidate will have the knowledge and experience to work in a fast paced Data Center environment. They will be responsible for the day-to-day operations and projects to ensure the continued success of Salesforce.com.
   

  

**Team**
 Salesforce is looking for an addition to our expanding Data Center Operations team. To join this team, you'll need to have a passion for technology, and love working with the next generation of trust enterprise computing in the world. We're a fast-paced, agile, and innovative team. We're highly collaborative and work across all areas of our the Data center technology stack. We focus on availability of our critical services for the business, qualify complex compute changes, and trail-blaze new engineering solutions for the cloud.
   

  

 As a key member of our team, you will work in a high-paced operations environment of Salesforce, the largest SaaS platform on the planet, working on the delivery and operations of scalable and innovative solutions for our modular compute infrastructure and proactively defending and securing our customers' data.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Conduct all day-to-day operations for the Data Center
* Installation of racks/enclosures and preparation of equipment to be installed.
* Update cable management system as changes are made to data center cable plant
* Update asset management system as equipment is added and removed from the data center
* Define tasks for each project and work with all Tech and Prod teams to meet project timelines as well as provide status to team members and management on the completion of all tasks
* Provide all information to assist with Data Center capacity planning for space and power.
* Handle all vendor resources to complete tasks as defined in SOWs
* Maintain relationship with providers to ensure day-to-day operational success
* Research new Data Center infrastructure equipment advancements and recommend changes as needed
* Conduct all audits as required by company policies
* Coordinate with the onsite delivery and shipping of all equipment.
* Will be part of an on-call weekly rotation shared across the Stockholm Engineering team


**Required Skills**
* Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent and relevant work experience
* 5+ years experience with Data Centers managing hardware assets
* Project management approach with the ability to handle tasks in short timeframes
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written in English
* Extensive experience with rack and stack of server and network equipment installations
* Solid day-to-day experience working in large, fast-paced heterogeneous environments, critical production data centers and co-location environments
* Solid experience working with teams of onsite infrastructure build out engineers and vendors
* Experience with a large variety of different vendor hardware such as servers, storage, and network equipment.
* Familiar with the processes of pulling, terminating and testing copper and fiber network cabling. Experience with performing inventories of all cable, power cords and other infrastructure items.
* Experience in contributing to detailed project plans for programs involving multi-functional teams and complex requirements
* Ability to multitask and manage numerous projects
* Demonstrated ability to coordinate issue resolution across departmental teams and global teams within multiple time zones
* Coordinating vendors, scheduling RMA's and on-site repairs as needed
* Experience with Asset Management systems
* Solid understanding of disaster recovery and business continuance methodology
* Strong sense of methodology, process, and metrics including familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies


**Desired Skills**
* Consistent record of success and delivering results
* Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills conducive to team development
* Physical work ability to lift at least 20-30 kg on a regular basis (server lifts are in use)
* Ability to travel nationally or internationally for training and in support of our growing remote locations


 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Data Analyst
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Data Analyst** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Data Analyst at Viaplay Group, you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data into actionable insights, enabling us to deliver exceptional experiences to our customers. By leveraging your analytical, visualization, and data modeling skills, you’ll inspire and lead the way toward a more data-informed business. Collaborating with diverse teams, you’ll be integral in evaluating trends, optimizing strategies, and supporting data-driven decision-making. Your expertise will help shape the future of Viaplay Group through enhanced user engagement, content performance, and operational excellence.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive business strategies and improve user experiences
* Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to bring the business closer to data by offering expertise, advice, and insights. Actively contribute to creating a data-informed culture across all levels of the organization
* Data Visualization: Build dashboards and reports with a strong focus on storytelling, making complex data easy to understand for stakeholders
* Strategic Impact: Partner with stakeholders to align data strategies with business goals, support roadmap decisions, and ensure appropriate tracking is in place for new initiatives
* Self-Service Analytics:Champion a self-service analytics culture across the organization, empowering teams to access, interpret, and utilize data independently
* Education & Communication: Lead and participate in data education initiatives to improve understanding and utilization of data tools and methodologies across the organization
* Process Automation: Identify opportunities for automation in data tracking, analysis, and reporting to streamline processes and improve scalability
* Documentation: Create standardized and accessible documentation to ensure clarity, reduce dependencies, and enable teams to operate autonomously


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Proven experience as a Data Analyst, demonstrating the ability to work independently and proactively drive change
* Strong knowledge of SQL and proficiency in visualization tools like Tableau or ThoughtSpot
* Expertise in data storytelling, with the ability to translate complex insights into clear, compelling presentations for technical and non-technical audiences
* A passion for setting up dashboards, KPIs, and reporting structures that inspire action and align with business goals
* A collaborative mindset, with the ability to build strong relationships and work cross-functionally
* A proactive approach to problem-solving, actively seeking new solutions and considering scalability in your work
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a talent for making others enthusiastic about data


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience with analytical engineering or tools like Databricks
* Background in the streaming or media industry
* Experience working with data from finance or marketing teams


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Product Success Manager - Health tech
description:
At
 **Platform24** 
 , we have an uncompromising focus on making every day better for patients and people working within healthcare, like doctors and nurses. Together, we impact lives globally by building healthcare 2.0.
   

  

 Now, we are looking for a
 **Product Success Manager** 
 who wants to shape tomorrow's healthcare.
   

  

 Joining our Professional Services team as a Product Success Manager means you'll be part of a team responsible for leading the implementation and adaptation of our platform according to our customers' needs. Your mission is to represent our product and technical capabilities to customers across Europe, such as private and public healthcare organizations. The role operates as an individual contributor and as part of smaller teams.
   

  

 This is a hands-on role where your wide range of tasks will include setting up implementation plans, creating communication material, visualizing customer solutions, writing business rules in the configuration layer of our product, coordinating multiple stakeholders, leading strategic discussions, and much more. In this role, you are in the middle of everything that happens with our customers. You will develop quickly and learn about our product, organization, and customers at high speed. Based on a deep understanding of our products and customer needs, you will match customer requirements with the right mix of product functionality, configurations, and consulting services. You will collaborate closely with other PSMs, Platform Architects, the Commercial team, and Product Managers to implement new designs when needed for our customers' success. The delivery of customer solutions will be yours to manage and secure a timely and successful platform implementation.
   

  

 Meet Emelie and hear her thoughts on what it is like to work as a Product Success Manager at Platform24.
   

  

**We Believe You Have**
* A goal-oriented mindset. Take responsibility for your work and being comfortable acting in an environment with lots of unknowns. You will pick up ideas and turn them into customer value, identifying all crucial activities along the way.
* Technical acumen. You are used to translating tech to non-tech people and can guide discussions to keep within the scope of technical and product limitations.
* Tech curiosity. You are eager to understand the internal workings of our platform so that you can make hands-on alterations to its functionality through different configurations in the product.
* Collaborative mindset. You are curious to seek information from others and are good at building efficient collaborations with team members. What the team can achieve is more important to you than your individual performance.
* Drive. We are out to revolutionize the healthcare system, so we keep a high pace. You get things done, rather than talk about it, and you are quick to take on the diverse tasks required to get the job done.
* Passion for healthcare. You are interested in improving its efficiency, quality, and accessibility.
* Communication skills. You're in the driver's seat for your customer segment or customers, and you will need to articulate how we can help them succeed with our products and services. You must be great at listening, communicating, and negotiating to get buy-in for your agenda.
* Problem-solving skills. You're analytical and used to analyzing quantitative data and making data-driven decisions.
* Language proficiency. Professional proficiency in Swedish & English, written and spoken, is needed.
* Relevant education. A relevant university degree or equivalent.


**What's in it for you?**
 The role belongs to the PSM team within Customer Services, a part of the organization that bridges the commercial and product teams to deliver professional services, customer success, and customer support. You will enter a role with many responsibilities and high expectations, in a warm and caring team where we help each other and have a lot of fun. To complement the firmwide social events, the PSM team and the Customer Services organization do offsites, team buildings, afterworks, team meetings, and much more.
   

  

 At Platform24, we recognize that we all have different needs when planning our lives. That is why we believe in flexible working hours to ensure work-life balance for everyone. We have Demo & Beers every other week, where we share our accomplishments (beers optional :).
   

  

**About Platform24**
 Platform24 is a leading health tech company combining intelligent automation with deep medical knowledge, building a platform that radically improves how healthcare is accessed and delivered for patients and clinical staff. We are changing how healthcare is done in public and private healthcare organizations. We are growing quickly, rapidly increasing our impact on healthcare across several European markets.
   

  

 Apply today!
   

  

 We're moving quickly, so apply! The sooner you get on board, the better.
   

  

 Location
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm, providing an exciting opportunity to work in vibrant and dynamic environments.
   

  

 Platform24 is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
   

  

 Platform24 develops system support for cohesive digital care chains that facilitate increased accessibility, efficiency and medical security. We are the largest company in the Nordic region when it comes to automatic triage for directing patients to the right level of care and the right care unit, even in complex flows along the entire patient pathway.
   

  

 Our customers include healthcare regions, private care providers, and insurance companies.

title: Operations Associate
description:
**TL;DR**
 We’re building an internal SWAT team to move Lovable forward fast. We’re looking for a hungry, sharp, and impact-driven Operations Associate who thrives in ambiguity, gets things done, and makes Lovable run faster and smarter. You'll be an internal force multiplier and a true generalist, working on everything from commercial strategy to admin to special projects. If you want to learn how to build a company from the inside of Europe’s fastest growing startup - we want to meet you.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (according to industry veterans)
* Work, learn, have fun: We’re building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


**What We’re Looking For**
* Hustler – You’re a problem solver who loves being resourceful to figure things out, especially when you’ve never done them before
* Bias for action - You see the problem, take the ball, and run with it
* Analytical rigor - You’re comfortable with numbers, systems, and logic. You always ask “why,” not just “what” to make systems better and faster.
* High ownership – You don’t just suggest the idea, but you drive it from start to finish, even when it gets difficult
* Clear verbal and written communicator - You can write a tight doc, represent Lovable externally, and explain the “so what”
* Low ego, team-first – No task is too small. You just do what needs to get done and you make the people around you better.
* Fast learner – You pick things up fast, ask smart questions, and adapt quickly to new challenges
* Thrives in the fire – You do your best work under pressure, with high stakes and tight deadlines. Chaos doesn’t scare you - it sharpens you.
* Bonus: You’ve worked at an early-stage startup or you have founder experience


**Your Responsibilities**
* Jump into anything and everything that helps move Lovable forward
* Conduct analyses and contribute to high-impact commercial and strategic decisions
* Support company-wide strategy execution and keep teams aligned and moving fast
* Drive internal operational excellence by improving how we work together, both in-office and remotely
* Help attract and retain top talent through recruitment, onboarding, and building meaningful team rituals Own and elevate the employee experience, from training programs to shaping culture
* Take on high-priority special projects that are often ambiguous but always important
* Automate internal workflows or build tools using Lovable to improve how we operate


**How Applying Works**
* Fill in a short form
* Jump on an initial exploratory call
* Join us for 2 days of trial work on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you
* Share 3 references of supervisors you’ve previously worked with


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you are interested please apply through our application system.

title: Entrepreneur-in-Residence (Business Development, Internship)
description:
**Location:** 

 Remote (Europe-based preferred) |
 
**Duration:** 

 3–6 months |
 
**Start Date:** 

 Flexible |
 
**Type:** 

 Internship (with potential for extension or employment)
 




  





**About NoviOcean** 





 Saving the Climate with Profitable and Stable Ocean Energy. That is our motto.
 





 NoviOcean is a cutting-edge cleantech company on a mission to harness the vast potential of wave energy to accelerate the global transition to 100% renewable energy. Our innovative ocean energy technology is designed to be simple, scalable, and sustainable—contributing to both climate resilience and long-term ocean preservation.
 




  





**The Role** 





 We are looking for a proactive, curious, and purpose-driven
 
**Entrepreneur-in-Residence (EIR) Intern** 

 to join our Business Development team. This is not your average internship. You’ll work directly with our COO on everything from strategic fundraising and partner acquisition to market research, investor materials, and business model development.You learn everything from the ground up.
 




 You will get a front-row seat in the early growth phase of a cleantech company tackling the global energy transition—and play an active role in shaping it.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 





 You’ll support and lead initiatives across several domains, including:
 




  




* **Fundraising & Investor Relations**
* Assist in preparing pitch decks, financial projections, and investor updates
* Research suitable grants, VC funds, and climate financing opportunities



  




* **Business Development & Sales Strategy**
* Identify, evaluate, and approach potential commercial and strategic partners (e.g., shipping companies, ports, project developers)
* Support pilot project acquisition and stakeholder outreach



  




* **Strategic Operations**
* Conduct market and policy research for strategic positioning
* Help build NoviOcean’s regional expansion strategies
* Support reviewing and negotiating international franchise/licensing agreements



  




* **Special Projects**
* Participate in key meetings and support with follow-up strategy and materials



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 



* A self-starter with entrepreneurial drive, curiosity, and a ‘figure it out’ mindset
* Strong communication and research skills
* Passion for climate tech, ocean innovation, or renewable energy
* Fluency in English
* Background in business, economics, sustainability, engineering, or related fields
* Bonus: Experience with fundraising, startup operations, cleantech, or marine industries



  





**What You’ll Get:** 



* A chance to contribute meaningfully to climate solutions at a systems level
* Freedom to take ownership and lead your own initiatives
* Flexibility in working hours and location
* A potential pathway to a long-term role within the team



  





  





**To Apply:** 





 Please send a short note about why this role excites you and a CV or LinkedIn profile to careers@noviocean.energy. Show us your motivation—we care more about mindset than a perfect resume.

title: Quality Manager to Coca-Cola Europacific Partners Sweden!
description:
**About Us**
 Coca-Cola Europacific Partners is one of the leading consumer goods companies in the world with a dedicated team of 42,000 people, who work together with manufacture, distribution, sales and industry marketing of Coca-Cola in 31 countries. In Sweden, we are around 750 committed colleagues at our production site and head office (also called "Happiness Factory") in Haninge outside Stockholm. CCEP Sweden represents some of the beverage world's strongest brands such as Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Powerade and Monster, but also strong local brands such as bonaqua and Mer.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Quality Manager at Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) you will have a dynamic and important key role where you interact broadly across functions and manage the quality support within the Swedish organization. Through your team consisting of 4 dedicated and competent people that you lead, you will ensure that the quality work meets the high level of standard within CCEP. Your main focus will be to lead and develop the quality work within our Supply Chain organization, which includes everything from raw material suppliers, production, maintenance, warehouse and distribution to complaints from customers and consumers. With your tactical capabilities, ability to act, energy and determination, you will contribute to CCEP’s continuous development and exciting journey as the world’s largest independent Coca-Cola bottler. You will report to Sr QESH Manager and the position is placed in Jordbro, Stockholm.
   

  

 In this role you will be expected to:
   

  

* Deliver a well-established priority plan of what is most important within your area of responsibility
* Provide a strategic plan regarding improvements that needs to be implemented – a plan on management level, supported by detailed underlying plans
* Deliver clear follow-ups and reporting on a monthly basis, or more often if needed
* Work with individual projects that aims to create structural change
* Work with the Quality community across CCEP and Northern Europe Business (NEBU) unit in particular
* Ensure fast and clear management and communication in case of emergency events or crisis within your area of responsibility


 This together will contribute to a continuous change over time, visible as a change of culture within your area of responsibility.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 We are consider it as requirements that you have:
   

  

* A relevant academic degree
* Several years of documented experience within Quality and Food Safety (HACCP)
* Knowledge and experience from working in management systems
* Knowledge and excellent skills within project management
* Knowledge in Swedish law regarding the different areas of responsibilities
* Fluent skills in English and Swedish


 To succeed and thrive in this role we believe that you:
   

  

* Are analytical with an ability to see patterns and trends in data. At the same time you also have the ability to see and communicate the bigger picture
* Are an excellent communicator. You know how to adapt you communication
* A person who has the knowledge and the ability to influence others
* Has the ability to handle potential conflicts in a proactive way
* Are a committed person who doesn’t face setbacks without finding inspiration to lead your organization towards the long-term goals. You are goal-oriented and driven by reaching set goals
* Have a passion for what you do which affects others. This also means that it is noticeable that you embrace the values you pursue in your organisation
* Know how to say no and stand up for your cause in a way that is clear and that increases your credibility, feels comfortable taking decisions based on data at hand
* Enjoy working in a high-paced environment where everything progresses very quickly. You adapt easily when circumstances change


**If this sounds like your kind of challenge, apply today!**
 Attach your CV and cover letter by using the application link. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Hellen Song, hsong@ccep.com. Please note that we do not accept applications through e-mail, due to GDPR.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) is a major fast-moving consumer goods business and the world’s largest independent Coca-Cola bottler. We usually say,
 **“You may join the brand, but stay for the people”** 
 , and it really is! With us, you get the opportunity to grow in a fast and innovative industry, together with our employees, consumers and customers. You get a lot of own responsibility from day one and the opportunity to really make a difference. Our recipe for success is that we are passionate, hard-working and committed to our products, our customers and each other. CCEP is a place where people can grow, be happy and be well in a safe, open and inclusive workplace. We value a diverse workforce and welcome you to apply regardless of gender, age or ethnicity. If you are interested in the stories of the people behind our beverages, please visit https://www.coca-cola.se/100voices.

title: Machine Learning Engineer, II
description:
The Personalization team makes decisions about what to play next easier and more enjoyable for every listener. From Blend to Discover Weekly, we’re behind some of Spotify’s most-loved features. We built them by understanding the world of music and podcasts better than anyone else. Join us and you’ll keep millions of users listening by making great recommendations to each and every one of them.
   

  

 We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer II to join our product area of hardworking engineers that are passionate about connecting new and emerging creators with users via recommendation algorithms. As an integral part of the squad, you will collaborate with engineers, research scientists and data scientists in prototyping and productizing state-of-the-art ML.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and refining Spotify’s personalization products by hands-on ML development
* Collaborate with a cross functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that advance our mission to connect artists and fans in personalized and relevant ways
* Prototype new approaches and productionize solutions at scale for our hundreds of millions of active users
* Promote and role-model best practices of ML systems development, testing, evaluation, etc., both inside the team as well as throughout the organization
* Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners in Europe (and across Spotify) collaborating with one another
* Together with a wide range of collaborators, help develop a creator-first vision and strategy that keeps Spotify at the forefront of innovation in the field.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong background in machine learning, enjoy applying theory to develop real-world applications, with experience and expertise in bandit algorithms, LLMs, general neural networks, and/or other methods relevant to recommendation systems
* You have hands-on experience implementing production machine learning systems at scale in Java, Scala, Python, or similar languages. Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc. is a strong plus
* You have some experience with large scale, distributed data processing frameworks/tools like Apache Beam, Apache Spark, or even our open source API for it - Scio, and cloud platforms like GCP or AWS
* You care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and disciplined experimentation
* You love your customers even more than your code


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the European region as long as we have a work location.
* This team operates within the GMT/CET time zone for collaboration.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Technology/Climate technology Underwriter
description:
Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 40,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com .
 



  





 In the Nordics we are an organization of 140 employees.
 



  





**The role purpose** 




  





 Chubb is growing and we are looking for a passionate Technology/Climate technology Underwriter to join our Technology Practice team in the Nordics. In the role as Underwriter, you will focus specifically on Technology and Climate Technology.
 



  





 Are you ready for the next step in your career and would you prefer to take it in a fun and professional team at an international, renowned insurer? Then you are in the right place.
 



  





 This exciting role can suit an Underwriter who is hungry, motivated, inquisitive and in need of a new challenge. We will consider a similar minded hardworking person who feels ready to take the next step in the career.
 



  





 We require someone to develop and assist in underwriting Technology risks. Maintaining and building relationships with our Nordic brokers community with an ambition to write additional new business, which will be key to the success of this role, as well as growing the existing portfolio in line with our agreed growth targets, pricing and retention budget.
 



  





**You make an impact and strengthen our market position by:** 



* Building and maintaining good relationships with brokers.
* Promoting our capabilities and building of a profitable Technology/climate technology portfolio.
* Strong commercial drive, always looking for new opportunities and value service and quality.
* Ensuring quality control by means of including underwriting and peer reviews.
* Representing and promoting Chubb to brokers and clients.
* Delivering strong service to brokers and clients, responding to cross-sell and new business opportunities and monitoring retention.
* Meeting the portfolio product line objectives of the Northern Zone Technology practice team for each underwriting year.



  





**Profile requirements :** 



* Fundamental understanding of and experience from underwriting processes preferably within Technology and Climate Technology
* Degree in Engineering, Computer sciences or business administration or technical / business experience background with an interest for new technologies.
* A strong commercial drive and very customer-oriented approach.
* Experience from client servicing preferably from the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated skills in building and maintaining client relationships preferably from the insurance industry.
* Results driven, disciplined and ambitious with ability to work on own initiative.
* Good communicator and fluent in Swedish (or another Nordic language) and high level of English written as well as spoken.



  





**Why You Want To Work At Chubb** 



* We offer a high-performance work environment in which appreciation and inclusiveness are of paramount importance.
* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.



  





 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Robin Roos** 
 , Technology Practice Leader for the Northern Zone via:
 ***Tel: + 31 61422 8765 / Robin.Roos@chubb.com.***




 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
*The Basware Customer Success team is a global organization ensuring high-quality delivery and customer experience. Our Customer Success team works closely with our customers creating joint success plans, offering practical guidance to help customers achieve their goals, and allowing them to drive their business outcomes.*
*The team helps to demonstrate the return on investment and acts as a trusted advisor. It's not simply about making the customers content with our products or services, it's about ensuring they are delighted and getting the most out of what we offer.*
*The Customer Success team monitors adoption and health and focuses on helping customers use our products and services effectively. This approach is essential for retaining customers, increasing the value they get over time, and expanding their usage of our solutions. In a nutshell our Customer Success team ensures a healthy and mutually beneficial customer relationship.*
 We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Customer Success Manager (CSM) to join our growing team. As a key member of our Customer Success organization, you will manage strategic enterprise customers globally, cultivating executive-level relationships, driving product adoption, and ensuring our customers achieve measurable value from their investment in Basware.
   

  

 This role is ideal for a driven individual with a strong blend of sales, relationship management, and SaaS experience who thrives in fast-paced, complex customer environments.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Own and manage strategic relationships with a portfolio of global, enterprise customers
* Partner with high-level customer stakeholders (VP and C-level) to align on goals, value realization, and long-term success strategies
* Lead value-based success planning, business reviews, and renewal/expansion discussions
* Identify and execute on opportunities for account growth and expansion, working closely with sales and cross-functional teams
* Confidently navigate complex, matrixed client organizations to ensure stakeholder alignment and sustained value delivery
* Act as a trusted advisor to customers, guiding them through product adoption and process optimization using Basware solutions
* Collaborate with Sales, Product, Marketing, and Services teams to advocate for customer needs and enhance the overall customer experience
* Deliver compelling presentations that communicate Basware’s value proposition and strategic impact to executive stakeholders
* Maintain a deep understanding of the customer’s business and industry to proactively identify success enablers and expansion opportunities


 ,
   

  

* 4+ years of experience managing global, enterprise customer accounts
* Proven experience working with high-level stakeholders (VP+) to build and strengthen business relationships
* Demonstrated track record of driving business expansion within large customer organizations
* Strong experience in strategic, value-based selling and outcome-driven account management
* Exceptional presentation, communication, and relationship-building skills
* Background in Customer Success, Sales, and/or Relationship Management
* Must have experience working within an ERP, Cloud, or Complex SaaS environment
* Comfortable navigating complex, global organizations and managing multiple stakeholder relationships
* Proven ability to grow customer accounts quickly and sustainably
* Strong cross-functional collaboration skills—able to align and influence internal teams across product, sales, and services


 Language skills: English mandatory, Swedish, German or French preferred

title: Javautvecklare till agilt utvecklingsteam - CGI Public & Defense
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du använda din kompetens för att göra verklig skillnad i samhället? Vi söker en erfaren Javautvecklare till ett agilt team i Stockholm hos en av våra kunder inom offentlig sektor.
   

  

 Här blir du en del av ett drivet team på cirka 10 personer som tillsammans arbetar i ett stort projekt med både nyutveckling, förvaltning och arkitektur. Vi jobbar agilt, vi tar ansvar för våra lösningar och vi har kul på vägen.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som systemutvecklare arbetar du med att designa och implementera nya programvarulösningar utifrån funktionella och icke-funktionella krav. Du kommer att på en kodnära nivå designa, dokumentera och säkerställa kvalitet i de tekniska lösningarna.
   

  

 Du arbetar i agila team, men ska också kunna arbeta självständigt och driva egna utvecklingsinsatser, felsökning och föreslå förbättringsåtgärder. Du förväntas utveckla och göra lösningsförslag både i frontend och backend.
   

  

 Du förväntas i din roll vara självgående men också en lagspelare. Du är nyfiken och tycker det är roligt att skapa förutsättningar för att teamet ska ta sig framåt.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Du har minst fem års erfarenhet av javautveckling, främst inom JEE där springboot har varit centralt i utvecklingen. Du kanske också har arbetat som lösningsarkitekt och brinner för effektiva lösningar inom systemutveckling.
   

  

 De senaste åren tror vi att du har arbetat främst med javautveckling men också front-end, med verktyg som till exempel angular/react. Du har erfarenhet av nyutvecklingsprojekt, openshift/kubernetes och är en fena på komplexa integrationer, kö-hantering och releationsdatabaser.
   

  

 För den här tjänsten tillkommer även säkerhetsprövning och krav på svenskt medborgarskap. Vidare talar du svenska och engelska obehindrat, både skriftligt och muntligt.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande konsultchef Lena Lundgren på lena.lundgren@cgi.com
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: CRM Team Lead
description:
**About XBP Europe**
 XBP Europe is an innovative, forward-thinking provider of bills and payment process solutions. Leveraging an EMEA-wide footprint and proprietary technology and services, we are backed by decades of industry-relevant experience.
   

  

 Bills and payment processes are increasingly omni-channel and paperless. That’s where XBP Europe comes in. Our offerings enable seamless workflows and frictionless transactions. XBP Europe combines physical documents, digital data, and instant messaging to help organisations work smarter. As part of that, we help to gather, process, and refine valuable data for use in decision-making.
   

  

 Our digital transformation solutions enhance efficiency, cash flow, and end-user experience. We serve a growing client list throughout Europe. See why organisations of all sizes choose XBP Europe as a digital transformation partner, visit our website at www.xbpeurope.com
   

  

**Job Description**
**Follow Us** 
 : Stay connected with us on social media to see what working at XBP Europe is like.
   

  

 Linkedin, YouTube, X, Facebook or Instagram
   

  

**Promote CRM Team Activity**
**Client Management**
* Manage CRM and Service Management Teams in the delivery of the client relationship for customer on all issues, MI & SLA reporting, invoicing, resolution of issues and incidents new services etc.


**Account Planning and Governance**
* Ensure that account planning and strategic approach is taken appropriate to the client in collaboration with Sales and Solutions as required
* Ensure that account contractual governance is delivered to clients at the appropriate level


**Develop Client knowledge/understanding**
* Identify and up-date Client organization (charts, decision levels and process)
* Understand the services/solutions provided to the customer
* Understand and know contracts (incl. MSA) (documents library maintenance and up-date), validate if requested (incl. SLA commitment and billing item)
* Renew expiring contracts


**Profitability Review**
* Work with Finance / PLM and Deal Bid Review to analyze profitability of new ACV, existing contracts and renewals in line with business direction
* Escalate to management when decrease of revenue/profitability or in case of low or negative profitability
* Support escalations from finance to follow-up payments and collect debt aged invoices


**Customer Satisfaction**
* Maintain high levels of customer satisfaction - Communicate any client risks to the wider group. Ensure that service performance challenges are proactively progressed and escalated within the organization.
* Promote positive XBP new brand initiatives
* Promote positive customer perception
* Provide statistics and reports to client
* Prepare and attend client steering committees
* Prepare and participate to external audits (client’s audits)
* Be the main client contact when necessary (except production level issues, monitored by delivery manager or team leaders): information, tech or delivery issues, SLA breach & penalties, claims


**Base Refresh Growth - Exela solutions and services promotion**
* Promote services and solutions to customers
* Sell add-ons and/or new services
* Escalate sales opportunities to Sales team (if exceeding CRM scope)
* Analyse and validate customer needs, business watch/intelligence
* Be responsible of a customer portfolio and the related revenue : grow this revenue accordingly to personal objectives (Quota)


**Key Requirements**
* Excellent language skills in Swedish and English. Norwegian and/or Danish is beneficial.
* 3- 5 years of experience in Customer Success/ Client Relationship Management or similar roles preferably in IT industry


**What We Offer**
* Permanent Contract
* Paid Holidays
* Annual bonus plan
* Medical Benefits
* Social package and employee benefits at the corporate level
* Referral Bonus


**Disclaimer**
 XBP Europe prioritizes individual privacy and is devoted to safeguarding personal data. Our recruitment policy focuses on selecting the most qualified candidates based on merit and skills aligned with position requirements. Candidate information is handled in strict compliance with GDPR policies and relevant data protection laws. Read our GDPR policy here.
   

  

 XBP Europe is committed to creating a diverse environment. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their characteristics or preferences. We provide equality, fairness and respect for all in our employment, whether temporary, part-time or full-time. We oppose and avoid all forms of unlawful discrimination including those known as protected characteristics.
   

  

 XBP Europe recruiters or representatives will only contact you by emails ending with xbpeurope.com or exelatech.com. We would never ask you for payment or ask you to deposit a check into your personal bank account during the recruitment process.

title: IT Architect - Hydro Assets
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Vattenfall is recognized as one of the first movers in the energy transition – and by that power climate smarter living for all our customers.
   

  

 Yet, our investment power, innovation, and ambitious change agenda to become fossil free in one generation, can only be met if our energy production assets are ready to deal with this electrification revolution. To face this challenge we invest in our people and we continue to employ exceptional IT talent. With our team, we are advancing  the Hydro business area in Vattenfall as a data driven company allowing them to optimize decision making and investment planning.
   

  

 Business unit Hydro Nordic is responsible for Vattenfall’s 90 hydropower plants and 400 dams in the Nordic region. Hydro’s renewable electricity generation is a prerequisite for a climate-smart and fossil-free society, and a sustainable energy system
   

  

 Together with them, you will be architecting:
   

  

* Full IT/OT convergence to ensure frictionless transfer of data (near) real time
* Supporting on our Next Gen ERP transformation
* Data Driven solutions (Predictive maintenance, Digital Twins, AI cases)
* Work on new market models (ancillary services),
* Bring Hydro to the next level by Modernisation of IT architecture
* Advanced solutions to deliver real-time insights into the performance of our Hydro assets to lower maintenance costs


 Our Group IT Architecture team of 30 enterprise / solution architects is involved in around 100+ key projects at any time, focusing on enterprise architecture and solution architecture for all Vattenfall business units. We act as the hub to understand business needs and to see the bigger Vattenfall picture to help our teams securely adopt the technologies of tomorrow.
   

  

**Your main responsibilities:**
* You will join the larger strategic projects, to guide them into successful execution based on fit-for-purpose architecture
* You will consult and educate the Hydro business on IT strategy, integration strategy, data strategy etc
* You have a solid understanding of IT security and will support Hydro in fit-for-purpose adoption.
* You will have (or build up) Hydro domain knowledge to become the go-to point how Hydro should advance its IT landscape.
* You will, in dialogue with business, drive a further adoption of data mesh
* You will help us grow our Enterprise thinking and establish standards and architecture principles. You will be our trusted advisor towards our Hydro and other business area’s to enable their operating model by technology – also if that is that means radical change!


 Din bakgrund
   

  

 We are looking for a generic and allround Architect, with experience preferably as Architect or Consultant in an asset intense industry (Energy, Water, Industry, Automotive or alike). Some experience with integration topics is an advantage.
   

  

 Our team requires true Business facing Solution architects; You know how to use technology to make our Hydro assets run as clockwork, you act as timer to ensure we meet our ambitious goals and be an alarm if we can do better! We have a large SAP and Microsoft footprint, with more than 20.000 users in six countries
   

  

 You feel comfortable communicating with both IT and non-IT colleagues on different levels in the organization. You enjoy being in an ever-changing environment. Furthermore you:
   

  

* Have an academic degree in IT or related study
* Have worked in an international environment and you speak Swedish and English
* Have deep IT knowledge and experience with IT architecture and frameworks
* Ideally bring experience from an asset intensive industry
* Have experience with Microsoft Azure Well Architected Framework
* You enjoy producing enterprise ready architecture documents
* And you have the skills to direct complex problems into concise Management Board action
* And… we love architects who talk business and know TOGAF, rather than those that talk TOGAF and know business …


**Location:** 
 for this position you will be based in Lulea, Sweden, with some occasional travelling to Hydro locations in Sweden and Vattenfall IT team events. (Stockholm, Solna).
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

**Our Offer**
* Become part of a massive transformative purpose – not on paper, but in real-life – whereby you can influence the outcome!
* We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field.
* You will work in an interdisciplinary team with other senior IT Architects – so we do this together!
* A professional environment where your experience, knowledge and attitude will bring us one step further and the opportunity for you to grow further.
* A central office location with easy access by public transport.
* Furthermore, a healthy work-life balance (smart working) and time to develop your profession
* At Vattenfall you get the opportunity to work for a clean energy company that aims for creating fossil free energy within one generation.
* And last but not least; International and multi-cultural work environment with energetic, motivated colleagues that like to have fun as well!


  

  

**More information**
 We welcome your application in English via our website. For information about the position, please contact recruiting manager Emile Das (NL), +31 6 5250 4359 or Rikard Haapala, +46702595746. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Recruiter Folmer Koper +31 6 38710915.
   

  

 At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps building a more profitable, efficient and attractive company. We continue to seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of gender, age, ethnic and cultural backgrounds.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

title: Procurement Business Partner
company_industry: Insurance, Banking, and Strategic Management Services
description:
Vill du vara med och implementera framtidens inköps-sektion där vi skapar en kostnadseffektiv och affärsnära verksamhet? Vi söker dig som vill ta nästa steg i karriären och bli en nyckelspelare i ett inköpsteam som gör verklig skillnad i rollen som Procurement Business Partner - strategisk inköpare med affärsfokus och kategoriansvar.
 



  





 Det här är en roll för dig som är van att arbeta nära affären, driva förändring och leda komplexa inköpsinitiativ. Du blir en nyckelperson i vår nästa fas där Inköp tar en strategisk roll och bidrar i både affärsutveckling, kostnadseffektvisering och hållbarhet.
 



  





**Det här gör du som Procurement Business Partner på Folksam** 




 Som Procurement Business Partner har du ett brett uppdrag och ären av Inköps primära gränssnitt för enheten Skador. Du samordnar och prioriterar Skadors inköpsbehov, etablerar starka samarbetsrelationer med skadeverksamheten och agerar rådgivare i inköp och avtalsfrågor. Uppdraget innebär också att vara ansvarig för att leda och utveckla inköpsarbetet inom sjukvårdskategorin, från strategi och analys till upphandling och att stötta i leverantörssamverkan. Du ansvarar för att driva avtalsförhandlingar och upphandlingar av olika IT-system och digitala lösningar som som har i syfte att stötta skadeverksamheten.
 



  





**Är du den vi söker?** 




 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga kompetenser och färdigheter.
 



 Rollen kräver hög affärsförståelse, stark kommunikationsförmåga och ett driv att leverera resultat i samverkan med andra. För att lyckas behöver du vara pragmatisk och ha hög integritet, driv och ett stort engagemang för att skapa värde - både i affären och för våra kunder. Du är självgående, analytisk, lyhörd och trivs i en miljö där förändring är en naturlig del av vardagen. Du gillar att tänka strategiskt, samtidigt som du får saker att hända. Vidare har du en skicklighet i relationsbyggande som gör att du upplevs förtroendeingivande. Du kan effektivt engagera och påverka olika intressenter.
 



  





 Vi ser också att du har:
 


* Universitet eller högskoleutbildning inom relevant område (industriell ekonomi, ekonomi).
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att bygga kategoristrategier, det är meriterande om erfarenheten är inom sjukvård.
* Minst sju års erfarenhet av att driva komplexa upphandlingar och förhandlingar i affärskritiska miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av att leda tvärfunktionella team i förändringsinitiativ eller transformationsprojekt.
* Erfarenhet av att driva IT-inköp.



  





**Utvecklas tillsammans med oss** 




 Folksam är ett kundägt företag med stort fokus på hållbarhetsfrågor. Vi har många roliga, utvecklande jobb och hos oss har du goda chanser till en spännande karriär med bra förmåner. Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Vi erbjuder flexibiliteten att varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån utifrån verksamhetens behov. Våra trevliga kontor runt om i landet ger mötesplatser för samarbete, lärande och en gemensam kultur – tillsammans skapar vi engagemang och kraft framåt! På folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar kan du läsa mer och se filmer om hur det är att jobba på Folksam.
 



  





**Så söker du jobbet** 




 För att söka tjänsten ber vi dig bifoga ditt CV och besvara ett antal frågor som utgår från aktuell kravprofil. Vid första urval kommer vi endast att utgå ifrån ditt CV och dina svar på frågorna. Vi önskar att du svarar konkret och kortfattat, och att det finns en tydlig koppling mellan dina svar och ditt CV. Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan senast 29 juni 2025.
 



  





 Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta sektionschef Piya Ibteesam Hossain, 070-989 15 50.
 



  





 Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Ann-Louise Andersson 070 -831 61 44, Forena Anneli Ersson 070-831 69 22 och Handels Mikael A Carlsson 070-831 51 32.
 



  





*Folksamgruppen erbjuder försäkringar och långsiktigt sparande som skapar trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi är cirka 4 000 medarbetare och vår vision är att våra kunder ska känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld. Vi engagerar oss i det våra kunder bryr sig om och är måna om att de är rätt försäkrade.*

title: Säkerhetssamordnare - Stockholm
description:
**Fortifikationsverket söker säkerhetssamordnare till gruppen för operativt säkerhetsstöd vid säkerhetsavdelningen. Vi befinner oss i stark tillväxt och gruppen för operativt säkerhetsstöd utökas nu för större förmåga att möta våra kunders behov på plats i verksamheten. Har du erfarenhet av arbete med säkerhetsskyddsfrågor och vill vara med och vidareutveckla säkerhetsskyddsarbetet i stora projekt, ansök redan idag!**
 Vi är en av Sveriges största fastighetsägare och experter inom fortifikation, det vill säga skydds- och anläggningsteknik. Vårt huvuduppdrag är att bidra till ökad försvarsförmåga för ett tryggt och fritt Sverige.
   

  

****Din uppgift - stärka Sveriges säkerhet i stark tillväxt****
 Enheten för säkerhetsskydd arbetar under Säkerhetsskyddschefen med inriktande, stödjande och uppföljande säkerhetsskyddsarbete på myndigheten. Enheten ansvarar framförallt för delområdena informationssäkerhet och säkerhetsskyddsplanering. Gruppen för operativt säkerhetsstöd ansvarar för löpande stöd inom hela säkerhetsskyddet. Gruppen ger riktat stöd till myndighetens projektavdelning och uppdragen bedrivs även i nära samarbete med Försvarsmakten och andra partners inom försvarsfamiljen.
   

  

 Som säkerhetssamordnare förväntas du delta i säkerhetsskyddsarbetet vid myndigheten och vara med och utveckla skyddet av Sveriges säkerhet. Du är aktiv att tillsammans med projektledare stödja säkerhetsskyddet i större projekt. Du deltar i samverkansform tillsammans med myndighetens partners inom försvarsfamiljen. Befattningen kräver gedigen kunskap och erfarenhet kring identifiering av skyddsvärden och hantering av säkerhetsskyddklassificerad information.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär många kontaktytor och samarbeten både inom och utanför myndigheten och du förväntas sprida din kunskap internt och externt genom att informera och utbilda. Du kommer att analysera och hantera säkerhetsskyddsincidenter och en del av arbetet kan även innefatta stödjande kontrollverksamhet. I rollen ingår identifiering av skyddsvärden i projekt, stöd vid säkerhetsskyddsanalyser och informationssäkerhetsanalyser. Resor förekommer i tjänsten och går att planera.
   

  

****Kvalifikationer****
 Vi söker dig som har eftergymnasial utbildning inom säkerhetsskyddområdet med mycket goda kunskaper inom säkerhetsskyddslagstiftningen och gällande föreskrifter. Du har erfarenhet av kvalificerat säkerhetsskyddsarbete och flerårig aktuell erfarenhet från arbete med identifiering av skyddsvärden, säkerhetskyddsanalys, fysisk säkerhet och informationssäkerhet.
   

  

 Du har ledarkompetens som vi bedömer tillfredsställande samt goda kunskaper i administrativa IT-stödsystem. Du kommunicerar och uttrycker dig väl både muntligt och skriftligt på svenska. Körkort klass B är ett krav.
   

  

 Det är meriterande med erfarenhet av säkerhetsskyddsarbete inom Försvarsmaktens eller Säpos regelverk gällande säkerhetsskydd. Om du har erfarenhet av att hålla föredragningar och genomföra utbildningar är det också positivt.
   

  

 Dina personliga egenskaper är mycket viktiga för oss. Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet och ditt engagemang. Vi behöver dig som är relationsskapande och har erfarenhet av att bygga nätverk och arbeta över organisatoriska gränser med olika kompetenser samt över myndighetsgränser. Att kunna skapa förståelse och helhetssyn för säkerhetsskyddsfrågor inom flera olika verksamhetsområden är en viktig förmåga för att göra dig framgångsrik i denna roll. Du kan på ett tydligt och otvunget sätt förmedla ditt budskap på såväl ledningsnivå som i den operativa verksamheten eller i ett investeringsprojekt.
   

  

 Du är strukturerad, positiv, självgående och har tålamod och förmåga att arbeta strategiskt mot långsiktiga mål. För att lyckas i rollen krävs att du är uthållig och engagerad i att driva ditt eget arbete framåt. Du har högt säkerhetsmedvetande med hög integritet och gott omdöme och en uttalad drivkraft att vara med och skydda Sveriges säkerhet.
   

  

****Vad erbjuder vi dig?****
 Tillsammans med ca 1300 kollegor på Fortifikationsverket runt om i landet jobbar du med ett unikt fastighetsbestånd för att stärka totalförsvaret i Sverige. Vi är stolta över det samhällsviktiga uppdrag vi har där vi bygger, förvaltar, sköter driften och utvecklar avancerad teknologi i samhällsviktiga byggnader. Våra arbetsuppgifter är omväxlande, spännande och utmanande och kräver sin kompetens. Vi arbetar enligt den statliga värdegrunden och dess principer och vi eftersträvar jämn könsfördelning. Lika rättigheter och möjligheter är viktigt för oss. Här får du goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling och ta del av bra förmåner. Vi jobbar också för att du ska kunna ha en bra balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, provanställning kan komma att tillämpas. Placering Stockholm Karlberg. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav, eftersom anställningar vid Fortifikationsverket är säkerhetsklassade. Det innebär att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter, har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den rekryteringsspecialist som finns namngiven så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan. title: Butikssäljare – Stockholm
description:
**Arc'teryx kommer till Stockholm!** 




  
 



 Bli en del av vårt team i Stockholm och bli vår framtida butikssäljare.
 



  
 



 Stockholmsbutiken kommer att vara unik! Ett utrymme på ca 430m2 som är dedikerat till Outdoor, beläget i Biblioteksstaden och med ett team på 10 personer.
 



  
 



 Internt kallas våra butikssäljare för ”Product Guide”.
 



  
 



 Du kommer att vara Arc'teryx ansikte utåt: ditt huvudsakliga uppdrag är att erbjuda en kvalitetsupplevelse till våra kunder och du fungerar som varumärkesambassadör.
 



  
 



 Du är produktbesatt och söker varje chans att komma ut för att experimentera och lära dig hur våra produkter presterar. Naturen är din plats och du ser gärna att andra gör detsamma! Du delar med dig av din produktkunskap till kunderna på ett öppet och objektivt sätt. Du har en stor känsla för service och kan rekommendera produkter utifrån kundernas intressen och behov.
 



  
 



 Du prioriterar din personliga och yrkesmässiga utveckling och du gläds åt andras framgångar. Du är medveten om att det är tack vare ett sammansvetsat team som vi kan uppnå fantastiska resultat!
 









  




**Som Product Guide för Arc'teryx kommer dina arbetsuppgifter att vara följande:** 
* Representera Arc'teryx som en varumärkesambassadör i butiker och i samhället.
* Ge våra kunder en kvalitetsupplevelse genom att dela med dig av teknisk produktkunskap.
* Vara en drivande kraft i butikens merchandising för att stimulera försäljningen.
* Behandla kundtransaktioner korrekt och effektivt: försäljning, produktgarantier, returer, inköp och returer.
* Vara en sann lagspelare med hela butiksteamet
* Vara bekväm med muntlig och skriftlig kommunikation: svara i telefon, röstmeddelanden och e-post i butiken.


 Observera att tillgänglighet på helger, helgdagar och under hektiska perioder är ett krav för denna tjänst.
 
  




**Vill du bli vår nästa Product Guide ?** 
* Du brinner för kundrelationer och att ge dem en kvalitetsupplevelse.
* Du brinner för friluftsliv (helst utövar du en eller flera friluftsaktiviteter).
* Det är viktigt för dig att vara ansvarsfull och att du gillar utmaningar.
* Du är flexibel och kan anpassa dig till alla situationer.
* Du har en utmärkt balans mellan självständighet och samarbeten.
* Du har utmärkta skriftliga och muntliga kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och kan kommunicera på engelska
 *(minst nivå B2).*






  




  


**Equal Opportunity** 




  





 Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance. 
 



  





 Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.  
 



  





 All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.
 



  





**Leave it Better** 




 We believe that the mountains transform us, that how we adventure matters, and that there’s always a better way. 
 



 Join us in creating positive change in ourselves, our communities, and the world. 
 



  





**Live it.** 
 Get out there - the mountains make us better 
 



**Disruptive evolution.** 
 In pursuit of better. Always. 
 



**Commit.** 
 We set bold objectives and see them through.

title: Sr. Sales Account Executive
description:
**The Big Picture** 
 We're looking for a sales rockstar to drive strategic enterprise sales for Tungsten Automation Corporation's intelligent automation platform. You'll be orchestrating enterprise deals that make your colleagues jaws drop, helping major enterprises transform their business processes through our unique combination of RPA, cognitive capture, and analytics.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Hunt and close new business within your assigned client base
* Build a sales pipeline 4X your target (go big or go home!)
* Orchestrate complex sales cycles with C-suite decision makers
* Cultivate at least 40 strategic relationships per account
* Partner with our lead gen and sales engineering teams
* Turn prospects into raving fans and referenceable clients


**You're Our Person If You Have**
* 5-8 years of crushing it in enterprise software sales
* A track record of consistently exceeding quotas
* Experience selling RPA, SaaS, or automation solutions
* The ability to navigate boardrooms as confidently as Zoom rooms
* A hunter's mindset with a consultant's approach
* Strategic sales methodology in your DNA
* Bachelor's degree (but your track record speaks louder)


**The Secret Sauce**
* You're part entrepreneur, part strategist, all closer
* You get energized by complex technical solutions
* You're always learning and growing
* You can spot strategic value faster than others spot problems


**The Fine Print** 
 Our platform is transforming how companies work, and we need someone who's ready to be part of that revolution. The rewards match the challenge - highly competitive compensation for highly competitive people.
   

  

 Ready to help us dominate the intelligent automation space? Game on.
   

  

***Tungsten Automation Corporation, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Vets***

title: Säljledare, butik - Stockholm
description:
Arc'teryx kommer till Stockholm!
 



  
 



 Bli en del av vårt team i Stockholm och bli vår framtida Säljledare!
 



  
 



 Stockholmsbutiken kommer att vara unik! Ett utrymme på ca 430m2 som är dedikerat till Outdoor, beläget i Biblioteksstaden och med ett team på 10 personer.
 



  
 



 Internt kallas våra Säljledare för ”Lead”.
 



  
 



 Vår Lead är en viktig medlem i butikens ledningsgrupp: du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med Assistant Store Manager och Store Manager med att driva butiken samt supporta och utveckla Product Guides (butikssäljare) och utveckla kundupplevelsen.
 



  
 



 Du kommer att spela en aktiv roll i butikens liv runt kundupplevelse, produktkunskap, försäljningsverksamhet, communities.
 



  
 



 Du är produktbesatt och söker varje chans att komma ut för att experimentera och lära dig hur våra produkter presterar. Naturen är din plats och du ser gärna att andra gör detsamma! Du delar med dig av din produktkunskap till kunderna på ett öppet och objektivt sätt. Du har en stor känsla för service och kan rekommendera produkter utifrån kundernas intressen och behov.
 



  
 



 Du brinner för att nå försäljningsmålen: du gör allt du kan för att se till att du och ditt team uppnår dem.
 



  
 



 Som Lead är det viktigt att alla hittar sin plats i teamet och får möjlighet att utveckla nya färdigheter. Du utvärderar Product Guides, hittar lösningar för att hjälpa dem att utveckla sina färdigheter och firar deras framgångar. Du inser att det är tack vare ett sammansvetsat team som vi kan uppnå fantastiska resultat!
 



  






  




**Som Arc'teryx Lead kommer dina arbetsuppgifter att vara följande:** 
* Leda teamet i linje med Arc'teryx vision, syfte och värderingar
* Leda, stödja driften och ledarskapet för butiken som inkluderar våra fem pelarna i verksamheten
 *(People, Experience, Product, Operations, and Community)* 
 , genom utbildning och tid i rollen så kommer du behärska och aktivera alla fem pelarna.
* Stödja produktguiderna i att leverera en fantastisk kundupplevelse genom att på ett autentiskt sätt dela med sig av teknisk produktkunskap och ge den feedback som behövs för att frigöra deras potential och hjälpa butiken att uppnå sina mål.
* Stödja lagerhanteringen under dagen för att maximera försäljningen, inklusive mottagning, bearbetning, påfyllning samt visuell merchandising.
* Behandla kundtransaktioner på ett korrekt och effektivt sätt: försäljning, produktgarantier, inbyten av begagnade varor och returer.
* Hantera rutiner för öppning och stängning av butiken enligt företagets och ledningsgruppens definition.
* Vara bekväm med muntlig och skriftlig kommunikation: svara i telefon, svara på röstbrevlåda och e-postmeddelanden från butiken.
* Bygga en gemenskap genom att aktivt dela varumärkesinformation och evenemangsspecifikationer med teamet och kunderna och se till att alla känner sig inbjudna att delta.


 Observera att tillgänglighet på helger, helgdagar och under hektiska perioder är ett krav för denna tjänst.
 
  




**Vill du bli vår nästa Lead?** 
* Du har ett eller flera års erfarenhet av att leda ett team och minst två års erfarenhet inom detaljhandeln.
* Du är entusiastisk över att utveckla en persons potential och att coacha andra kommer naturligt för dig.
* Du brinner för kundrelationer och att leverera en hög kvalitativ kundupplevelse.
* Du har bevisad förmåga att sätta en tydlig vision, anpassa ditt team kring gemensamma mål och främja engagemang för dessa mål.
* Din passion för att leda ett team är parallell med din passion för naturen. ”Live It” är ett våra värden och vi ser att du är en person som tillbringar mycket tid i naturen där du klättrar, vandrar, åka skidor, springer etc.
* Du kommunicerar flytande skriftligt och muntlig på Svenska såväl som på Engelska.






  




  


**Equal Opportunity** 




  





 Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance. 
 



  





 Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.  
 



  





 All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.

 We believe that the mountains transform us, that how we adventure matters, and that there’s always a better way.

 Get out there - the mountains make us better
